data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward you can continue forward without taking 9 steps left. If you always face backward you can continue backward without taking 10 steps backward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning right after turning around carries you back to the starting place. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around: You start from and when to turn around. 6 steps gives you half of the time. Let' s take 4 steps to return to the starting point. 10 steps gives you the full time. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can only take one step to back to where you started. It’s not possible to take one step back from where you started. Take 5 steps if you don’t want to take a second step. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes 3 steps. Turning around and taking 10 steps bring you back to your starting place. Thus, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and turn around. Turn around and take 7 steps to return to your starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot return to the starting point once you turn around. You cannot take the 6 steps twice and then take the 8 steps again. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Walking forward is not always correct. Walking left doesn't always lead to the starting point. Taking 4 steps forward does not always lead to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

After taking 9 steps, go back to the starting point. The first time you take 2 steps then take 3 steps to get you back to where you started. When you take 7 steps, you have reached your starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps forward and you are still facing forward. Take 1 step backward and you are still facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Each step backward is taken forward. Each step right is taken backward. Each step left is taken left. You can get to the starting point by heading backwards or straight forward or both. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you return to the starting point, try to always face forward. If you follow this with 3 steps right, you always go left. If you follow this with 5 steps right, you never go forward. If you follow this with 5 steps left, you always go right. If you follow this with 5 steps backward, you only take half of that. If you follow this with 5 steps forward, you always go right. When you return back to the starting point, try to always face the right way. If you follow this with 5 steps right, you always go forward. If you follow this with 5 steps right, you always go left.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow an instruction, you always face forward with the feet facing forward. You are not facing back when you step forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The instructions are very general so they are likely to lead to different outcomes. A person would go backwards, but when people follow the instructions they go forward. People are omniscient and have a general idea. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around means you go around the side of the building. You cannot proceed backwards. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around: You take back to the starting point after you take ten steps. Take 6 steps: You take back to the starting point after you take seven steps. Take 10 steps: After you take 10 steps, you turn around and take 9 steps. Take 3 steps: This is the second step you take after you take three. Take 6 steps: This is the third step you take after you take nine. So, the answer is No.

Taking 7 steps would return you to the starting point. Turning around would return you to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn around and take 1 step. It gets worse when you take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One way to return to right is to turn right. If you take 7 steps to return to right, you take 5 steps to return to right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You turn left and take 6 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once you are in the starting position you have gone back to start point. The way you have turned around is to go back where you started. The answer: Yes.

You take 3 steps out of the starting position. Then you take 7 steps after the turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In the beginning, one goes forward. One starts backward. In each direction, one moves forward. Forward is the direction always facing forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The starting point should always be forward. The starting point may move at any time. Taking 9 steps to the left causes the starting point to move in the direction of the opposite direction. So, the answer is No.

Turn around. Take 4 steps. Return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

To go backward in forward motion is different from going forward in reverse. So, the answer is No.

Turning right and taking 5 steps turn around and turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

For every 2 steps forward, you should take 3 steps backward for example. For every 3 steps backward, you should take 3 steps backward for example. So, the answer is No.

If you return to the starting point, you take 4 steps. Thus, the answer is 2 steps.

Yes means you must take 9 steps in order to turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you return to your starting point. If you always face backward, you take 7 steps left. If you always face forward, you take 3 steps left. If you always face forward, you take 1 point backward. If you always face right, you take 3 steps up. If you always face left, you take 7 steps backward. If you always face right, you take 6 steps left. If you always face left, you take 7 steps backward. If you always face right, you take 5 steps up. If you always face left, you take 3 steps backward. Otherwise, you take 5 steps up. If you always face right, you take 3 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If you turn around, you go back to the starting point. The answer: No.

Your movements do not have to take 3 steps backwards. The starting point can be a different one. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

It does not matter which direction you move as long as you continue to face forward.. Taking 4 steps right and also taking 1 step backward is considered a forward motion. Taking 18 steps left and also taking 8 steps left are considered backward actions. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

At the start of each sentence the writer asked you to always take 3 steps forward. At the end of each sentence you are asked to take 3 steps forward and 3 steps back. The last sentence in the first sentence of a story suggests that you always take 2 steps back. And the last sentence of a story suggests that you always take 4 steps back. So, the answer is no.

Turn around from the starting point. Turn around 3 times.

If you face forward but take 4 steps forward, it is easier to get back. If you face forward and take 6 steps forward but take 4 steps forward, it is also easier to get back. If you face forward and take 6 steps backward, it is even harder to get back. So, the answer is no.

Take 5 steps is the same as take 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

The starting point is always the end point. Each step is an opposite action. One cannot take 4 steps backward and take 3 steps left at the same time. All actions return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is No.

If you always facing forward, you will also always face forward. If you always face backward, you will always face backward. You cannot always take 2 steps backward. If you always face forward, you will always face forward. So, the answer is no.

In these directions, in order to get to the starting point, you must always face forward. In the first step for any of the steps, you must always take 4 steps left to go backwards. So, the answer is Yes.

Every person has to go in one direction. One is always facing forward. One may or may not face the wrong direction. One can not always return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You can go backward, forward, left, backward, right, or both. Each step allows you to return to the beginning point. So, the answer is no.

When a person faces forward, the forward step takes that person backwards from the opposite direction. The opposite direction takes 4 steps forward and 1 left, so if you’ take 4 and a left, it takes you to the opposite direction. Therefore, the answer is No.
